events.title: UC Application Overview by UC Rep
Homecoming Week: Lunch Rally - Football Field
CSU Application Overview by CSU Rep

updates.body:
Student Announcements - Week of 10/6/25

District-wide Student Meeting: Are you interested in sharing your thoughts on school board policies, including the Advanced Diploma and cell phone use, directly with the superintendent? Join the meeting at El Carmelo Elementary auditorium on October 6 at 5:30 p.m. Chipotle will be provided!

Spirit Swap! Bring your old spirit wear to the bins outside Room 502 by October 10th. Swap for this year's gear and help reduce waste!

SAT Tutors Needed! Hey, seniors! Paly's Tower Learning Center is looking for SAT tutors. Earn community service hours! Please email Ms. Lee to apply.

Hey Firebirds! Get ready for Dodgeball Olympia! Next week, sister classes (Juniors & Freshmen vs. Seniors & Sophomores) will go head-to-head in epic dodgeball battles during lunch in the large gym on Monday, Wednesday, and Friday. Pick up a waiver from the ASB office to play!

Join the PAUSD LGBTQ+ District Council - Student Members Wanted!

The PAUSD LGBTQ+ Council is currently seeking new student members to create a safe, supportive, and protective environment for LGBTQ+ students and allies. Participants are asked to attend monthly online meetings. If you are interested in joining, please contact Director of Mental Health and Wellness, Dawn Yoshinaga. All are welcome!

Picture Day Retakes

On Monday, September 29th, Lifetouch will be in the Fair Oaks Room from 8AM until about 2:30PM. If you need a re-take, or never took a school photo, please get your photo done on Monday.

Volunteer Opportunity: Advanced Authentic Research (AAR)

The AAR program is looking for student mentors and career speakers. This is a great opportunity to build leadership skills and earn service hours. Meetings are 4-5 hours per month. See the school website to get involved!

Haunted House 2025 Auditions!

The Fremont Theatre Department is holding auditions for the annual Haunted House. Anyone from Fremont can apply to be a host, character actor, or scare actor! Scan the QR code on the posters in the hallway to apply.

Reminder for Lily Chen's AP Music Theory Class

Don't forget that your first composition project is due this Friday, October 10th. Please be prepared to present your piece to the class. Office hours are available Wednesday and Thursday after school if you need help.

Volunteer for the Library Book Fair!

Hi Lily, the school library is looking for student volunteers for the upcoming Book Fair in November. Help set up, run the cash register, and recommend books to younger students. It's a fun way to earn volunteer hours and get a discount on books! Sign up in the library.

Fall Orchestra Concert

To all orchestra members, our Fall Concert is scheduled for Thursday, November 13th at 7:00 PM in the main auditorium. Please ensure you have your formal concert attire ready. Full dress rehearsal will be after school on November 12th.

From the Office of the Superintendent

Student voice is central to our work. This month, students in grades 3-12 will have the opportunity to share their perspectives through the Panorama surveys. Their feedback helps guide our programs and initiatives that support social-emotional growth, belonging, school safety, and a positive school climate.

October 20-October 30: Students complete the Student Well-Being survey in their classrooms. Responses are confidential.

New Paly Cell Phone Policy

Starting this school year, Paly is implementing a phone-free classroom policy. Our goals are to minimize distractions, build a culture of learning, and increase engagement. Phones must be placed in the designated holder at the start of class and remain there until the period ends.

PE Department Update

Monday, Oct 6th is 'A' group swimming! Please check the gradebook to see if you have anything to make up. Make-up opportunities will be available next week. Keep up the good work!

Get Involved - Join the Paly Principal Advisory Committee (PAC)!

Want to help shape the Paly experience? PAC gives students a direct way to share ideas and feedback with the Principal about learning, campus life, and ways to make Paly an even better place. The group meets once a month during lunch (food provided). Fill out the application by Monday, August 25th.

FBLA Meeting Announcement

FBLA will hold its first meeting of the year tomorrow in the Shannon Theater at the beginning of lunch. Come meet this year's officers and learn about FBLA and our upcoming regional competitions! Please, no food in the theater.

Art Club Kick-off Meeting

Hi Lily! The first Art Club meeting of the year will be this Thursday, October 9th, after school in Room C-2. We'll be discussing ideas for our fall mural project and electing club officers. Bring your creativity (and a friend)!

Holiday Drive for Doggie Protective Services

The Wellness Center has organized a holiday drive for a local animal rescue. Please consider donating toys, treats, beds, bowls, towels, and blankets for dogs and cats. Donation boxes are at the Paly Wellness Center (P-4) and the Guidance Center.

AP Exam Registration is Open

Hello Paly AP Students. Registration is now open for the 2026 AP Exams. You must be registered with both the College Board and Total Registration. Deadlines matter! The College Board's late fees are costly. Sign up early and don't wait until the last minute. For questions, contact Mr. Berkson.

Photography Club: Golden Hour Photo Walk

Hey Lily, join the Photography Club for a 'Golden Hour' photo walk next Tuesday, October 14th. We'll meet at the flagpole after school and explore the campus to capture some amazing light. All skill levels and camera types (including phones) are welcome!
